poem:
Title: Upon the Worrying Silence of Disrepair

Beneath the cold, grey breast of brine,
Lurk veins of dormant peril, twine
Of Man's creation, laced with dread.
Mercury's whisper, unsaid.

O, we who thirst for blackened ichor,
Will we the reapers of our fervor?
With a sigh, the North Sea breaks,
Under burden of human mistakes.

Polonium's ghostly residue,
Speaks of a reckoning overdue.
